newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Shipyard in spotlight on Lithuanian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Shipyard in spotlight on Lithuanian bourse.

text.p: The Baltic Shipyard stirred Lithuania's sleepy bourse as 16.27 percent of its shares changed hands in block trades on Monday.
But the central market remained mixed as investors appeared to favour top blue chips over the rest of the pack.
Official list shares jumped 16.23 points to 932.09 points, while group A shares fell 14.55 points to 1854.57 points.
"I dont think there's much of a future in list A and list B shares," said one broker, adding that investors were running to official list shares in search of quality.

Official list Hermis Bank advanced to 210 litas from 203.50 litas on the central market, turning over 164,000 litas. Hermis shares saw a busy 3.3 million litas worth of block trades at 195 litas to 203.50 litas a share.
Dealers say Hermis Bank looks fairly cheap despite a six-month result which fell a bit short of the market's expectations.
Rival Vilniaus Bank advanced to 240 litas from 231 litas on central market turnover of 187,000 litas.
The bank said on Monday its profits for the first half of the year rose to 21.4 million litas compared to 11.7 million litas in the same period last year.
Dealers said its result exceeded the market's expectations but were divided on the impact they would have on its price.
Baltic Shipyard was the centre of attention in trade of 11.4 million litas in a block trade which involved 16.27 percent of its shares.
Dealers did not say who was involved though speculation centres on Denmark's Odense Shipyard, which bought 40 percent of the company's shares in March.
